captions.text:
Voice-over: Good morning, Hank and John. You
remember that epic Batman argument you had?
John (speaking): I kind of HATE Batman...

Voice-over: It just got songified so... now
we can all dance to the sound of brothers

Hank (singing): You've got Batman ENTIRELY
wrong. John, we are all bat-people.

John (singing): Hank, Gotham never gets better
for long. Crime is not actually caused by

Hank (singing and overlapping John): We are
all bat-people!

John (singing): Crime is not actually caused
by evil!

John (singing): Batman's just a rich guy with
an affinity for bats, who is playing out his
insane fantasy... how is that heroic?

Hank (singing): Batman's values and actions
are a reflection of our own values and actions

John (singing): Doesn't Batman understand
how difficult it is for an underfunded city
like Gotham to replace roads and bridges?

Hank (singing): We see ourselves in the cracks
in his facade, in his anger and frustration
because we have all these things too.

Hank (singing): John, you've got Batman ENTIRELY
wrong..... John, we are all Bat-people!

John (singing): Hank, Gotham never gets better
for long... Crime is not actually caused by

John (singing): Crime is not actually caused
by evil!

John (singing): Crime is caused by systemic
disenfranchisement and poverty and lack of

Hank (singing): We are not the heroes Earth
needs (echos)... but the heroes Earth just

Hank (singing): John, you've got Batman ENTIRELY
wrong! John, we are ALL Bat-people!

John (singing): Hank, Gotham never gets better
for long. Crime is NOT actually caused by

John (singing and slightly overlapping Hank):
Crime is not actually caused by evil...

Hank and John at the same time: John/Hank,
I will see you on Friday/Tuesday.

(voice-over clip from suggested video plays
over endroll)

title: BONUS: We Are All Bat People (Songified Batman Argument)

comments.author: Mivet426

comments.text:
A couple things that are perplexing me:
1.) I am genuinely surprised that their opinions aren't actually switched. 
John is an author who is know for his "imagine complexly" catchphrase and 
therefore I feel like John should have Hank's opinion!
2.) "Gotham never gets better for long" is that saying that "Oh well, 
anything we do won't make a permanent difference, let's not bother." I'm 
not trying to be critical at all, I'm just surprised John would say 
something like that (And yes, I am aware that he might not apply that 
thought to everything)

I bought the Hank shirt and actually planned on buying both (mainly because 
I liked John's quote shirt design better... and I wanted a shirt with the 
word affinity on it!) But I figured it would be stupid to wear a shirt 
saying something I didn't really believe in. It probably sounds like I'm 
taking this too seriously but hey.﻿
comments.author: angelswave88

comments.text:
In John's original video, John is trying to make a point about how a single 
man trying to make the world better doesn't really work. (I guess you could 
say he's asking all of us to imagine the whole world more complexly, cuz 
y'know it's mindbogglingly complicated and stuff.) Like if batman could see 
the bigger picture, he'd donate money to Gotham's poor and invest in 
Gotham's infrastructure, rather than fight crime all by himself and making 
the situation worse for Gotham. DFTBA!

comments.author: Jon Fuller

comments.text:
I think you both have good points.

I think no one is born evil, circumstances make us evil. Usually not 
overnight usually slowly these evil traits creep up on us. I think we all 
have a few evil traits we just do on auto and don’t register we rationalise 
them in our heads.

I think batman is just doing his best he (like me prior to this argument) 
probably never thought about the cost to Gotham of the bridges and 
buildings of fighting evil. He probably didn’t think well maybe I should 
 set up a better education system instead.. Like the rest of us he’s doing 
his best to muddle through life and we all have bad and good qualities (we 
are all bat people ).

I think we definitely identify with him as with anyone because we see 
traits of him (anger and frustration as mentioned by Hank).

Basically overall …. I don’t think batmans just a rich guy with an infinity 
for bats there’s so much more to him than that so #teamhank.

The main thing the songs just cool ;)﻿
